paragraphs.text: The readers' editor on... mistakes made in an article about Amal Clooney and the 'al-Jazeera three' jailed in Egypt.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The arrest and conviction of three al-Jazeera journalists in Egypt has been the subject of a worldwide campaign to secure their release
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The men were seized from a hotel and given long jail sentences on charges of abetting terrorists, spreading false news and endangering national security
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On Friday 2 January 2015 the Guardian published online an interview with Amal Clooney
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who represents Mohamed Fahmy, one of the three jailed journalists
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The other two are Baher Mohamed and Peter Greste
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The interview, which ranged over many aspects of the case, was given in the wake of the appeal hearing in Cairo on 1 January in which the three men were told they would have to face a retrial
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: During the course of it, Clooney revealed that a report which she co-authored had pinpointed flaws in the Egyptian judicial system that subsequently contributed to the three men's conviction
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: She told the Guardian that when the report, compiled on behalf of the International Bar Association, was due to be published "...first of all they stopped us from doing it in Cairo
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They said:'Does the report criticise the army, the judiciary, or the government?
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We said: 'Well, yes
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They said: 'Well then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you're risking arrest
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: A story headlined:"Egypt warns Amal Clooney she risks arrest over al-Jazeera three" was published at 3.19pm on 2 January on the Guardian's website
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The first sentence said:"Egyptian officials have warned human rights barrister Amal Clooney that she risks arrest after identifying serious flaws in its judicial system that contributed to the conviction of three al-Jazeera journalists now jailed in Cairo."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: due to an editing error in London, two key aspects of the story had been conflated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: both the headline and first sentence were wrong
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Clooney had not been warned that she risked arrest "over the al-Jazeera three"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The warning about what might happen if the report was published in Egypt had been given in February 2014
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: long before she had any involvement in the case
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: This was a significant error
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Patrick Kingsley, the Guardian's Cairo correspondent, who has reported on the case of the three journalists since they were arrested and who also conducted the interview, contacted the Guardian's foreign desk within 35 minutes of the story going up on the website to warn of the errors and amend the copy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He had received complaints about the headline and the thrust of the story from Clooney
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Amendments were made
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the headline now ran:"Egypt warns Amal Clooney she risked arrest"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But there was no footnote or correction published because of the short time lapse between publication and amendment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: our guidelines state that errors caught within the first hour or so, which have not excited comment, do not necessarily need to be footnoted
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I think that on this occasion it was a mistake not to add one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It was a significant error
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: one has to recognise that Clooney is a well-known figure
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The amended version was the one used in the print edition published on Saturday 3 January
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At 10.05 on Sunday 4 January the story was updated, with the addition of two paragraphs from the Egyptian police denying the allegation that Clooney faced arrest
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Editors were still concerned that the story lacked clarity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: further changes were made to the first few paragraphs to make the chronology clearer, ie that the warning of possible arrest related to what might happen if the report earmarking judicial flaws was published in Egypt
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: These changes were made on the evening of Monday 5 January
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: finally a footnote was added:"This article was amended on 4 January 2015 to include comments from the Egyptian police. It was further edited for clarity on 5 January 2015."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At this stage there had still been no formal complaint to the readers' editor's office, but by 5pm editors made me aware of the problems
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I wrote a longer, fuller footnote
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a correction was published online that evening and in print on Tuesday 6 January
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what I had not initially realised was that Clooney had co-authored an article for the Huffington Post website with Mark Wassouf, who also represents Fahmy, published on Sunday 4 January
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In it, primarily, she set out the issues facing the three men including Fahmy, but also addressing her concerns about the Guardian story
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In it she raised a fresh concern of which we were unaware
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: She described those who warned her of a possible arrest if any attempt was made to publish the report as "experts in Egyptian affairs"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: whereas
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they were described in the text of the Guardian story as "Egyptian officials" and a subheading said she was "threatened by the authorities"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The Huffington Post story said:"An article was published in the Guardian newspaper on 2 January 2015 stating that officials threatened Amal Clooney with arrest in Egypt in connection with her representation of Fahmy
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The incident that was recounted in fact arose in early 2014
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the International Bar Association's Human Rights Institute (IBA) - which was organizing the launch of a report co-authored by Mrs Clooney- was warned by experts in Egyptian affairs who were consulted on the launch that she and her colleague risked arrest if they launched the report in Cairo, in light of the criticisms made in the report and recent prosecutions for 'crimes' like insulting the judiciary, government or military in Egypt
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: As a result of these warnings, the IBA decided that it was not safe to hold the launch in Cairo, and the authors were forced to hold it in London instead
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: This incident arose before Mrs Clooney's involvement in the Fahmy case, before the current president was in office and in a context entirely unrelated to this case
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: More importantly, the focus today should not be on the risks that lawyers or journalists faced in the past
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The focus should be on the risks of free speech in today's Egypt."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: When
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Guardian asked Clooney on 5 January for more details of the individuals who gave the warning
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: she replied that the language she used had been reviewed by a colleague in the International Bar Association's Human Rights Institute who was involved in writing the report and organising the launch, who agreed with the description that they were "experts in Egyptian affairs"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I am not able to establish any more details about them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I think the Guardian believed that, in the context of the interview, the "they" to which Clooney refers were Egyptian officials who had given the warning
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But we didn't confirm that before publication, and in the light of that we have made a further set of changes to the headline, subheading and text
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In my view, it is a legitimate story and a matter of public interest that there was a warning of possible arrest in relation to publishing in Egypt a report about flaws flaws in the country's judicial system that subsequently contributed to the conviction of the three men
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The report said Egypt's judicial system was not as independent as it could be
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It pointed out that officials in the ministry of justice have wide powers over nominally independent judges, and highlighted the control the government can exert over state prosecutors
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There is a clear link
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Guardian collectively made a number of errors by conflating two key aspects of the story, including a significantly misleading headline
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I apologise on behalf of the newspaper to Amal Clooney for those errors
paragraphs.label: other
